website_summaries.verdict: The Dell Inspiron 13 7000 Series 2-in-1 is a well-built, 13-inch convertible-hybrid laptop that delivers solid all-around performance and features a crisp In-Plane Switching (IPS) display.

customer_reviews.title: Good specs but junk hardware
customer_reviews.text: Good specs but junk hardware. Experienced frequent ghost touching on the touchscreen. Cleaning the screen made no difference. Didnt matter if it was in Laptop mode or Tablet mode. Suddenly for no reason the screen would act as though it was being touched everywhere all at once for about 5 seconds. Sometimes the 'ghost touches' would end up closing programs, clicking links if you were on the internet, zoom in, etc. It just depends on what you happened to be working on at the time. It was very frustrating to use. Ended up returning this to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this after having a macbook, which I had spilled coffee on. It's a good buy. The processor is quick, and it hasn't slowed down much in the several months that I have owned it. I, too, had the problem of "ghosting" on my touch screen, but it is possible to turn the touch screen off. I really didn't get this for the touch screen or tablet functions, so I just keep the screen off and the problem is solved. Overall, this was a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sadie

customer_reviews.title: Defective screen design
customer_reviews.text: The screen on this computer is faulty, I could not recommend any one buy it. It is very thin and has a plastic housing, so bends quite easily, The bending messes up the touch matrix and you start getting phantom touches all over the screen. The volume buttons are annoying too. They do not reverse when the screen is flipped, so are backwards in laptop mode.
